name: Jemaa el-Fnaa
description: The main square of Marrakech, used by locals and tourists. By day it is largely an open space; by night it transforms into a theater of folk groups, snake charmers, and food stalls.
safety_tips: Be careful of pickpockets in crowded circles. Negotiate prices with snake charmers BEFORE taking photos.

name: Petit Taxi
description: Small beige/yellow taxis that carry up to 3 passengers. They are the most common way to move around Marrakech.
safety_tips: Always ask the driver to turn on the meter (Compteur) immediately. If they refuse, find another taxi.

name: Tanjia Marrakchia
description: A traditional dish cooked in a clay pot (tangia) in the embers of a hammam furnace. It contains beef or lamb, preserved lemon, and saffron.
safety_tips: Eat at reputable stalls where you see locals eating.
